communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOJ subpoenas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the "more than 20 subpoenas to doctors and clinics involved in performing transgender medical procedures on children" regarding investigations of "healthcare fraud, false statements, and more," announced by the Office of Public Affairs on July 9, 2025.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I request a complete waiver of all search and duplication fees. If my request for a waiver is denied, I request that I be considered a member of the news media for fee purposes. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Under the FOIA Improvement Act of 2016, agencies must adopt a presumption of disclosure, withholding information “only if . . . disclosure would harm an interest protected by an exemption” or “disclosure is prohibited by law.”

The FOIA Improvement Act of 2016 also amended the FOIA as follows (5 USC 552(a)(8)):

(A) An agency shall—
(i) withhold information under this section only if—
(I) the agency reasonably foresees that disclosure would harm an interest protected by an exemption described in subsection (b); or
(II) disclosure is prohibited by law; and
(ii) (I) consider whether partial disclosure of information is possible whenever the agency determines that a full disclosure of a requested record is not possible; and
(II) take reasonable steps necessary to segregate and release nonexempt information. . .

In the event some portions of the requested records are properly exempt from disclosure, please disclose any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions of the requested records. If it is your position that a document contains non-exempt segments, but that those non-exempt segments are so dispersed throughout the document as to make segregation impossible, please state what portion of the document is non-exempt, and how the material is dispersed throughout the document. Claims of nonsegregability must be made with the same degree of detail as required for claims of exemptions in a Vaughn index. If a request is denied in whole, please state specifically that it is not reasonable to segregate portions of the record for release.

Further, “the withholding agency must supply ‘a relatively detailed justification, specifically identifying the reasons why a particular exemption is relevant and correlating those claims with the particular part of a withheld document to which they apply.’”

In addition, I ask that your agency exercise its discretion to release records which may be technically exempt, but where withholding serves no important public interest.

If a portion of the responsive records become available before the entire request is complete, I respectfully request that the department provide records on a rolling basis.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Obama Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related to Election Day Death of Russian Consulate Employee Sergei Krivov

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related to Election Day Death of Russian Consulate Employee Sergei Krivov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, news clippings, email threads, text messages or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the death and news coverage of the death of an employee of the Russian Consulate in New York City named Sergei Kirvov. The death was profiled in a BuzzFeed article titled: "The Strange Case of the Russian Diplomat Who Got His Head Smashed In On Election Day." News coverage implied that the circumstances around this individual and the death were more mysterious than the Russian government claimed and that it resembled other deaths of Russian individuals in the same time frame. 

The election day 2016 death of Sergei Kirvov received limited and measured news coverage from mainstream news sources. It additionally spread in a more conspiratorial manner on social media in the weeks after the 2016 election. Most of the news coverage of the death was in the months following election day. Please limit the search, naturally, to between November 8th 2016 and January 20th of 2017. 

Search terms:
"Sergei Kirvov"
"Sergey Kirvov"
"Cergej Kirvov"
"Russian consular employee death"

If there is not NSC Correspondence about this death or news coverage or social media chatter about the death, then publicly say so and close the request. 

News coverage for context: 
https://nypost.com/2016/11/08/dead-man-with-head-trauma-found-at-russian-consulate/
https://zakonbase.ru/content/part/293588
https://www.rferl.org/a/russian-embassy-guard-found-dead-new-york-no-foul-play-suspected/28105096.html

Thank you for the Obama Presidential library for the commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Bias Incident Reporting: Philadelphia Commission on Human Relations (July Request)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

With respect to incidents reported using the “Hate Incident Reporting Form”:

1. Any documents concerning the response (by PCHR or any other agency) to any reported incident labeled as the “incident type”: “hate speech” since January 1, 2020.

2.  Any documents concerning the response (by PCHR or any other agency) to any reported incident labeled as “incident classification”: “bias comment” since January 1, 2020.

3. Any documents concerning the reported incident or the response (by PCHR or any other agency) to the reported incident on 10/1/2024, summarized in the annual report as: “Paper found in Chinatown with the message, "Hey Chinatown, 76ers Arena & Mayor Parker love you long time," and, "Hey Mayor Parker sold out to billionaires & construction unions to get reelected so bend over & take it with a smile!"

4. Any documents concerning the reported incident or the response (by PCHR or any other agency) to the reported incident on 4/14/2024, summarized in the annual report as: “A poster stating "families for ceasefire" hangs in the window of a state representative's office in West Philly.”

5. Any documents concerning the reported incident or the response (by PCHR or any other agency) to the reported incident on 9/7/2022, summarized in the annual report as: “Unknown neighbor displays a sign reading, "Whites go away!"”

6. Any documents concerning the reported incident or the response (by PCHR or any other agency) to the reported incident on 12/18/2021, summarized in the annual report as: “Bias comment made during a meeting with victims of Asian hate where the statement was made, "this is our country and we have been oppressed for 400 years. You all have your country."”

7. Any documents (including, but not limited to, policies or training materials) concerning how an incident is “verified” or “confirmed” by PCHR as a hate/bias incident.

The names, phone numbers, and mailing addresses of citizens should be redacted from any responsive documents. 

“Document” means any record consisting of handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, photocopying, transmitting by electronic mail or facsimile, and every other means of recording upon any tangible thing, any form of communication or representation, including letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combinations thereof, and any record thereby created, regardless of the manner in which the record has been stored.

I request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying the responsive records. The Foundation for Individual Rights in Education (FIRE) is a nonprofit, nonpartisan organization dedicated to defending, preserving, and extending civil liberties. The records sought herein are not sought for a commercial purpose. As discussed in greater detail below, the release of the information requested will further the public’s understanding of the City of Philadelphia’s efforts to address the concerns of its citizens with respect to social issues, as well as PCHR’s policies and practices regarding offensive speech and its citizens’ First Amendment rights. The purposes of the Pennsylvania Right to Know Law will be furthered by a waiver of costs because the documents requested will contribute substantially to the public’s understanding of how government officials implement policies relating to offensive speech, and whether those efforts and policies are consistent with the First Amendment.

If you deny any portion, or all, of this request, please provide me with a written explanation of the reason(s) for your denial, including a citation to each specific statutory exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. If you conclude that portions of the records that I request are exempt from disclosure, please release the remainder of such records for inspection and copying, redacting only the portion or portions that you claim are exempt. For any exemptions, please note whether it is discretionary and, if so, the basis for refusing to exercise discretion in favor of granting access.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Admissions Data Follow-up
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

As you requested in your last message, this is a follow-up for additional clarifying data to that released under FOIA 27-77.

While providing the reasons for requesting the records and their use is not required under the FOIA, we wanted to do that as a courtesy as it may save the level of effort on your part to know that as well as identify what we “should have asked for” but didn’t. The other schools we’re contacting for data to use in the trends analysis found that helpful as when we get the data from multiple sources it needs to end up being “apples to apples”.

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The overall purpose of the project is to do a comparative analysis of admissions for Peer or near-peer colleges and university to identify trends that may impact planning and execution of admissions strategies and goals. To that end we need not only the student demographics, but the application and admissions timelines.

For example. If the majority of applicants do not make their decision on completing the application or accepting the offer to attend until shortly before a matriculation date that creates a serious planning issue for Institutions like VMI who have to plan for a wide range and do not have sufficient reaction time to implement mitigations strategies. This would be of benefit to many colleges as we do not believe such analysis is ongoing.

In VMI’s case there was one year where it appears due to COVID and other factors enrollment (those who matriculated) was extremely low. If the perspective students did not notify VMI until shortly before (or just did not show up) it puts the school in a bind to provide opportunities to others and, more importantly, may have left some good potential students without sufficient time to react and arrive to matriculate.

It is one goal to see what the trend is for today’s freshmen on when they make the decisions and what visibility schools have of that.

Academic years covered:

2015 - 2016
2016 - 2017
2017 - 2018
2018 - 2019
2019 - 2020
2020 - 2021
2021 - 2022
2022 - 2023
2023 - 2024
2024 - 2025

REQUEST 1: An excel or .CSV file of the entire SSR database (report) as provided in the last FOIA with all fields, except for PII and an explanation of the field codes.

This would be the best as it would require little to no level of effort on VMI’s part to simply export the entire file(s) without any PII fields. 

We respectfully request this as it may have some fields we do not know exist in the report/database that could be valuable in our research.

ALETRNATE: If it is not possible to just provide files of the entire database (minus PII) we request the following.

1.	A list of all SSR codes and their meaning for all fields in the SSR Database.

2.	The breakout of ALL applicants to VMI by race, ethnicity, gender, and within each of those, which were athletes and non-athletes:

a.	Date of initial contact
b.	Date of Initial Application
c.	Date of full application competition
d.	Date Accepted or Declined by VMI (i.e. Appointment or denied appointment)
e.	Date of partial deposit
f.	Date of full deposit
g.	Date CAD- cancelled after paying the deposit (but before becoming a full reservation)
h.	Date CBD- cancelled before paying the deposit
i.	Date CR- cancelled after becoming a full reservation (deposit paid and medicals approved)
j.	Date TDMD- appointed but medically disqualified
k.	Date MT- matriculated
l.	Other fields that will allow developing trends and profiles of the timeline between cadets applying to VMI and final disposition if they attend or not.

3. The number and dollar value of each scholarship or tuition assistance for each MT cadet by race, ethnicity, gender, and within each of those, which were athletes and non-athletes, with the source of funding (e.g., VMI Agencies, Federal Government, VMI internal funds, other).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: City of Port Hueneme City Council Member Text Messages/Electronic Communications During Council Meetings

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Time frame: January 1, 2025 – July 18, 2025
Records requested: All text messages, emails, and social media messages sent or received by any member of the Port Hueneme City Council during all official City Council meetings within the above timeframe, across any devices (personal or municipal), that relate to the conduct of public business.
Under City of San Jose v. Superior Court (2 Cal. 5th 608, 629 (2017)), communications—whether by text, email, or social media—are public records if they concern the conduct of public business, regardless of the device or account used. 
Additionally, the California Supreme Court has held that messages sent on personal devices by public officials, even during official meetings, are subject to public disclosure. 
Please provide the records in electronic format, with timestamps, sender, recipient, and message content.
If any portion is withheld, please cite the specific statutory exemption and describe the nature of withheld content.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Complaints to IRS About USS Liberty Veterans Association's Tax Exempt Status
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Inquiry Regarding Complaints and Investigation Status of USS Liberty Veterans Association’s 501(c)(3) Status

Dear Madam or Sir,

I am James Russell, an independent journalist who covered the USS Liberty Veterans Association’s (LVA) reunion in June 2025, where individuals associated with extremist views were invited as keynote speakers. 

Following the event, concerned citizens filed complaints challenging the LVA’s 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status because of hate speech.

I am requesting information on the number of complaints filed against the LVA’s 501(c)(3) status and the current status of any related investigations, and names of individuals who filed the complaints.

title: Medicaid Data Agreement between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services (Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

### Background ###

A widely read media report said that "Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials will be given access to the personal data of the nation’s 79 million Medicaid enrollees, including home addresses and ethnicities, to track down immigrants who may not be living legally in the United States, according to an agreement obtained by The Associated Press. The information will give ICE officials the ability to find 'the location of aliens' across the country, says the agreement signed Monday between the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services and the Department of Homeland Security." You can read the report here: https://apnews.com/article/immigration-medicaid-trump-ice-ab9c2267ce596089410387bfcb40eeb7

My request is seeking a copy of this agreement.

### Request ###

- A copy of this agreement between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services
- If you are not able to search for the agreement based on that request language, I alternatively request a copy of all agreements between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services, from 1st January 2025 to the present.

To aid in the search, a direct quote of the agreement is "ICE will use the CMS data to allow ICE to receive identity and location information on aliens identified by ICE"

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a journalist writing for 404 Media and that this request is being made as part of news gathering.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Cox

To further assist your search, the agreement is called "Information Exchange Agreement Between the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) for Disclosure of Identity and Location Information of Aliens"

Thank you.

title: Medicaid Data Agreement between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

### Background ###

A widely read media report said that "Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials will be given access to the personal data of the nation’s 79 million Medicaid enrollees, including home addresses and ethnicities, to track down immigrants who may not be living legally in the United States, according to an agreement obtained by The Associated Press. The information will give ICE officials the ability to find 'the location of aliens' across the country, says the agreement signed Monday between the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services and the Department of Homeland Security." You can read the report here: https://apnews.com/article/immigration-medicaid-trump-ice-ab9c2267ce596089410387bfcb40eeb7

My request is seeking a copy of this agreement.

### Request ###

- A copy of this agreement between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services
- If you are not able to search for the agreement based on that request language, I alternatively request a copy of all agreements between DHS and the Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services, from 1st January 2025 to the present.

To aid in the search, a direct quote of the agreement is "ICE will use the CMS data to allow ICE to receive identity and location information on aliens identified by ICE"

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a journalist writing for 404 Media and that this request is being made as part of news gathering.

Sincerely,

Joseph Cox

Thank you.

title: Ohio Public Records Request – Body-Worn Camera - Arrest of Paige Cox (Aug 23, 2022)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio Public Records Request – Body-Worn Camera - Arrest of Paige Cox (Aug 23, 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the arrest of Paige Cox (born 06/08/1994) on August 23, 2022, by the Cincinnati Police Department.

The arrest followed a single-vehicle crash. Ms. Cox refused a chemical test after being read Ohio's ALS form, and was cited under R.C. 4511.19. The arrest occurred in Hamilton County, Ohio.

The involved officers were identified by the following badge numbers:

• Badge P895 – Arresting Officer
• Badge P492 – Witness Officer

The enforcement location was listed as 3201 Warsaw Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45205.

I am requesting:

All body-worn camera (BWC) and dash camera footage from officers P895 and P492 and any related patrol vehicles that were at the scene.

Please provide the records in digital format (via email or downloadable link). If any records are withheld, I request a written explanation citing specific legal exemptions under Ohio law.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: TDEM emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Copies of all emails, including attachments, sent and received by Nim Kidd from 7/01/2025 through 7/09/2025.
- Copies of all emails, including attachments, sent and received by Warren Weidler from 7/01/2025 through 7/09/2025.
- Copies of all emails, including attachments, sent and received by Orlando Alanis from 7/01/2025 through 7/09/2025.

Expedited Processing Request
Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) and applicable regulations (e.g., 5 C.F.R. § 1303.10(d)), I request expedited processing on the grounds that there is an urgency to inform the public about potential federal government activity that could significantly affect technology policy and governance. The records requested have far-reaching implications for data privacy, employee retention, and litigation exposure. Delayed disclosure of these records would compromise the public’s timely understanding of critical government functioning. As a journalist actively reporting on the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Texas Department of Emergency Management, I have a compelling need for expedited access to this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Molly Taft

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

For the Flock system operated by Metro Transit and by any other Bi-State entities, please list the entity operating Flock devices, and:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

title: FDEM Alligator Alcatraz attorney contact emails

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FDEM Alligator Alcatraz attorney contact emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All emails to or from the address "legal@privacy6.com" between July 2, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

An FDEM spokesperson provided the above email address in a July 15 Miami Herald story for attorney correspondence and scheduling at the "Alligator Alcatraz" detention center : https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/immigration/article310625140.html

Under Fla. Stat. § 119.0701(1)(a), private contractors are subject to public record law when they contract with public agencies and are acting on behalf of the public agency in providing those services.  

Please also note that when responsive records contain exempt material, the custodian must redact the applicable portions and release the rest of the records. “A person who has custody of a public record who asserts that an exemption applies to a part of such record shall redact that portion of the record to which an exemption has been asserted and validly applies, and such person shall produce the remainder of such record for inspection and copying.” Fla. Stat. § 119.07(1)(d) (2020)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FinCEN 2024 and 2025 FOIA Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FinCEN's FOIA request log covering 2024 and 2025 through the date of your fulfillment of this request (or the start of the week when you fulfill this request since I know you receive requests regularly). Please include a field showing the summary of request, date received, requestor, and subject of each request and a field for the final disposition.

Further, I request that this document be sent in any digital formats in which it exists (such as PDF or Excel).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn A
